Game.Name: Play-Yan (Japan)
Game.plot: The Play-Yan is a media player application originally released for the Game Boy Advance. It is also compatible with the Nintendo DS capable of backwards compatibility. The cartridge has an SD flash memory input that allows the user to store and play MP3 audio files and H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video files. The user interface has a very sleek streamlined look with several sound effects and images reminiscent of the Nintendo universe. Additionally, the software is capable of playing 13 bonus mini-games designed by the WarioWare team. The quick pick up and play games can be downloaded directly from Nintendo of Japan's homepage. The 12 standard mini-games are Avoid, Bat, Fire, Fish, Insect, Jump, Keeper, Memory, Nekoroid, Nose, Triple, Wave. The thirteenth game is a secret game available to Club Nintendo members only. The games are all simple in design sharing many similarities with the Game & Watch and WarioWare series.
